docs.text: Babel Library A truer present begins with reading. 我是 Scarlett，一枚读者、新移民、游走于技术边缘的艺术家， 一名关心他人与社会的思考者，一位试图把学术见解带入公共空间的局外人。欢迎来到这片小天地，共同坠入阅读的世界。 Hi, I’m Scarlett — mostly a reader, sometimes a newcomer still figuring things out, occasionally an artist wandering at the edge of technology, and often just someone trying (and failing) to think seriously about the world. This little space is where I sneak academic curiosity into everyday life. Let’s get lost in reading together and find our way out. 阅读书籍｜Reading as Art (We Practice It Every Day) → 每周书评 Weekly Bookreview 他者空间｜Toward the Other (Books in Community) → 加入社区 Join Community 祛魅书籍｜Disenchanting the Book（History of Books/Reading） → 爬梳学术 Academic Literature

docs.text: 投稿 · 阅读作为艺术 / Submit · Reading as Art 请用 200–400 字 完成“三步”： 1) 我为什么此刻读它？（1 句情境） 2) 它带我看见了什么？（2–3 个发现/转念） 3) 我希望谁来读？（给到“他者”的指路） 投稿表单 （Google Forms / Airtable）： 字段建议：书名 / 作者 / ISBN / 馆藏链接 / 短评 / 标签 / 署名或匿名 / 邮箱（不公开）/ 同意 CC BY-NC 4.0 转载（勾选）
docs.title: 投稿 · 阅读作为艺术 / Submit · Reading as Art

docs.text: .bs-sidebar { position: relative; } .bs-sidebar::after{ content:""; display:block; height:220px; margin-top:12px; border-radius:12px; background:url("../img/disenchant-card.jpg") center/cover no-repeat; box-shadow:0 6px 18px rgba(0,0,0,.12); } @media (max-width: 991px){ .bs-sidebar::after{ display:none; } } 祛魅书籍｜Disenchanting the Book 试图以科学的方法祛魅书籍， 认真梳理知识、权力、书籍以及阅读的关系， 努力还原一名真实读者在历史中的模糊脸庞。 With rigorous methods, I seek to disenchant the book: to patiently map the entanglements of knowledge, power, reading, and the book, and to bring into focus the once-blurred face of real readers in history. 书籍史/阅读史前人论述 Scholarship in History of Books/Reading 研究主题背景书目 Historical Context of the Research Topic 研究方法及理论书目 Research Methods and Theoretical Framework 论证材料及证据 Sources/Materials/Data
docs.title: 总览 Overview

docs.text: 试图以科学的方法祛魅书籍， 认真梳理知识、权力、书籍以及阅读的关系， 努力还原一名真实读者在历史中的模糊脸庞。 With rigorous methods, I seek to disenchant the book: to patiently map the entanglements of knowledge, power, reading, and the book, and to bring into focus the once-blurred face of real readers in history. 书籍史/阅读史前人论述 Scholarship in History of Books/Reading 研究主题背景书目 Historical Context of the Research Topic 研究方法及理论书目 Research Methods and Theoretical Framework 论证材料及证据 Sources/Materials/Data

docs.text: .bs-sidebar { position: relative; } .bs-sidebar::after{ content:""; display:block; height:220px; margin-top:12px; border-radius:12px; background:url("../img/reading-as-art.jpg") center/cover no-repeat; box-shadow:0 6px 18px rgba(0,0,0,.12); } @media (max-width: 991px){ .bs-sidebar::after{ display:none; } } 阅读书籍｜Reading As Art 阅读是一种行为艺术， 是我们的日常以及态度。 今日，这片园地种下的是一份书单， 它会如小树一般，混着阳光、雨水 肆意生长，直达天空的彼岸。 Reading is a performance art— our daily practice and our stance. Today, in this small garden, we plant a reading list; like a sapling drinking light and rain, growing as it pleases, reaching the far edge of the sky. 最新书单 → Booklists 书评目录 → Reviews
docs.title: 总览 Overview

Today, in this small garden, we plant a reading list; like a sapling drinking light and rain, growing as it pleases, reaching the far edge of the sky. 最新书单 → Booklists 书评目录 → Reviews
